column1:
## Presenting complaint
79-year old man who came in on the 2024-01-29 with most likely influenza. Discovered on the floor by specialcare facility personnel where patient lives.

## Medical history
Advanced chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, active smoker, benign prostate hyperplasia, schizophrenia.

## Clinical course
Patient reported experiencing a headache and pain in left hip. No abnormalities in physical examination. Temp 38,7. Sat 85%. CRP 143. PCR positive for Influenza A. CT brain, cervical spine and pelvis without remarks. CT thorax: patchy bilateral pulmonary infiltrates and 9 mm large nodular lesion in the left upper lobe. Received Oseltamivir and Cefotaxime intravenously for Influenza infection and suspected on top bacterial infection. Received Oxygen with saturation limit 90%. Patient feels better after antibiotics. Dyspnea only during mobilization. Shown growth of Moraxella in the nasopharyngeal culture. No findings in other cultures. CRP 199, rising initially. LPK normal. Temp 38,8. Liver enzymes a bit elevated, assessed to be due to influenza. No fever. Saturation 95% with 1 l oxygen but declined to 88% without Oxygen. Receives a urinary catheter because of residual urine 533 ml. Recieves Movicol for contstipation. After five days of Cefotaxim switch to per oral doxycycline until 2024-02-04 after contact with infectious disease consultant. Patient uses walker to mobilise and has fallen multiple times lately. Transported to the geriatric care department as recommended by the physiotherapist and occupational therapist.

## Medications
Anoro Ellipta (Umeclidinium, Vilanterol)	55/22 Î¼g/Î¼g 1+0+0
Finasterid (Finasteride) 5 Mg	1+0+0
Olanzapin (Olanzapine) 10 Mg 1+0+0
Tamiflu (Oseltamivir) 75 Mg 1+0+1
Alvedon (Paracetamol) 500 Mg 2+2+2
Doxycyklin (Doxycycline)100 Mg 1+0+0 until 2024-02-04

## Post-discharge plan
Referral to primary care for follow-up chest imaging of nodular change in left upper lobe in 8-12 weeks.

## Procedures
  None performed.

## Secondary diagnosis
Influenza due to other identified influenza virus with unspecified type of pneumonia
Unspecified bacterial pneumonia
Advanced chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
Benign prostate hyperplasia
Schizophrenia

## Primary diagnosis 
J10.0 Influenza due to other identified influenza virus with unspecified type of pneumonia
J15.0 Unspecified bacterial pneumonia

## Differential diagnosis
Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease with (acute) exacerbation
